name: Serious Sam Double D XXL
description: Pile on the firepower with the revolutionary Gunstacker and fire all your weapons at once in a symphony of destruction!
minimum_requirements: OS: XP, Vista, 7 Processor: 2.0 GHz or faster (Dual-core recommended) Memory: 1GB Hard Disk Space: 500MB  Video Card: 128 MB Card, supports Shader Model 2.0 DirectX®: 9.0c Sound: DirectX 9.0c Compatible sound card Additional: Microsoft Xbox 360 Controller or XInput controller

reviews.review_text: Where else can you combine a tommy gun, shotgun, rifle, chainsaw, and rocketlauncher into a single gun? Where else I ask you... WHERE ELSE?!

This game got a lot of poor reviews since it isn't something that is likely to appeal to the sheeple mainstream, but I absolutely adore it. It is the most fun I've ever had in a 2d sidescrolling shooter, and for speedrunning or just generally screwing around it is a blast (especially once you get the jump pad and master its use). Sure, the premise/story/gunstacking/etc. stuff is silly and over the top, but this is Serious Sam! It's all *about* the insanity, and despite DDXXL being a kind of 'side game' to the FPS trilogy, it is actually one of my favorites.  If you like frantic shooters, tons of secrets to discover, advanced movement-based abilities, completely ridiculous scenarios, a very unique visual style, a decent amount of challenge modes, and just generally blasting the hell out of everything you see... Serious Sam Double D XXL is for you. Screenshots absolutely do not give it justice, and many of the videos I've seen just don't capture how fun it is to *play*.  For the traditional Serious Sam fans: I understand why you wouldn't really be interested DDXXL, but give it a shot as if it's a totally different franchise... I think you'll really enjoy it once you get used to its oddities. Yes, the campaign is fairly short. Yes, some of the challenges are just spam-fests. But it has fun enough gameplay and mechanics that you'll love to replay it over and over.  And for those that like to speedrun, glitch, etc. this game is a treasure trove of awesomeness. Some may consider that a symptom of a buggy/predictable/whatever game, but it's really only like that if you're intentionally trying so I consider it a feature. Have fun breaking it to bits and seeing what kind of insanity you can cook up!  My only real complaint: the unlocked difficulty levels really aren't that much harder since you start with all your guns and upgrades that you got during the previous playthroughs. I really wish they had made the harder difficulties packed to the gills with more enemies and more difficult situations, but unfortunately the first few levels are pretty much exactly the same on harder difficulties as they are on the easiest. This really isn't that big of a deal (as I'm sure many find the game very, very difficult as-is), and more just a wishlist item if devs ever returned to it.
Serious Sam Double D XXL * 8/10

More fun than I expected based on how ugly this game looks and feels. Took me back to a lot of worthwhile-but-not-great SNES and...uh...Game Gear games I enjoyed as a kid. Especially when it comes to the level design, which is probably the best aspect of this game. The secrets hidden throughout are, er, adorable. Xzibit and the Land Before Time. Hawwwwwww.

The amount of crying on the Xbox 360 version's Metacritic page (The PC version doesn't have one) made me think it would be a crappy paid for add-on. HELL NO! It's free for Double D owners, allows you to play the original (though you'd be a damn fool to do it) or the expanded version with a few big improvements and fixes:  1: Upgrades- really cool and adds a new level of play to the game.  2: Awesome bonus levels- riding on top of a dinosaur shooting rockets? Yup.  3. Can't abuse the quicksave function anymore- SHIEEEEEEEEET. It was broken though, now you get checkpoints as your primary save.  4. New chat interations during story- listening to more dialouge is better than it sounds.  5. Co-op- In case if you have any friends.  All in all, for free DLC to an already good game, you should get it for sure. Good job MBG and Devolver for taking the risk of putting out a game like this- it was worth it.   Only 9/10 because of no online play where people can call me gay and teabag my corpse.

Serious Sam: Double D is a spinoff of the Serious Sam series; the game is chaotic, as to be expected from Serious Sam, while also changing a few key features to make it completely different from the classic Serious Sam we all know and love. The “gun stacker” is a cool new feature which literally lets you stack multiple weapons on top of each other in order to increase your output of chaos and mayhem. The system itself is not very deep because the guns have very little functionality beyond doing more damage; there is nothing particularly unique about the new guns that are obtained during the game. The art style is good for the eyes, and the monster design is outrageous to the point where it’s amusing; there are giant hamsters on wheels that can kill you! The environment variety is plentiful, I wish can say the same thing about the music. Sadly this iteration of Serious Sam has very weak replay-ability, beyond just getting the achievements and secrets.

SSDD features a unique gunstacker system, oodles of replay value, and humour that is faithful to the original games. A worthy addition to your Serious Sam collection.

This game puts you in a freaky setting where you have to blow thru hordes of mobs that randomly spawn around you, it's very intense.   It's a fast paced game consisting of some very sexy weaponry, and the best part of it all? You can have up to 6 guns equipted at ONCE... if you so choose too, but it'd be much more difficult, which isn't bad.  I forsure would recommend this game to anyone who is interested in Side Scrollers!
